framework_meta.name: business_ethics
framework_meta.description: Analyzes business communications across three domains of ethical concern: stakeholder relationships, operational integrity, and strategic vision. Demonstrates flexible dipole clustering on defined arcs.

primary_sources: Freeman, R.E. (1984). Strategic Management: A Stakeholder Approach
Solomon, R.C. (1992). Ethics and Excellence: Cooperation and Integrity in Business
theoretical_foundation.theoretical_approach: Stakeholder-based ethical analysis focusing on three domains of business responsibility clustered around specific arcs of analytical space.

coordinate_system.description: Circular coordinate system with dipoles clustered in three defined business ethics domains

positioning_strategy.description: Dipoles clustered within specific arcs representing distinct domains of business ethics

stakeholder_relations.description: Stakeholder relationship ethics clustered in upper-right quadrant

operational_integrity.description: Operational and governance ethics clustered in left quadrant

strategic_vision.description: Strategic and long-term vision ethics clustered in lower-right quadrant

dipoles.name: Customer Relations
dipoles.description: How business communications treat customer needs and rights

positive.name: Customer Service
positive.description: Prioritizes genuine customer benefit and transparent value delivery

negative.name: Customer Exploitation
negative.description: Prioritizes extraction of value from customers over genuine service

dipoles.name: Employee Relations
dipoles.description: How business communications address worker dignity and development

positive.name: Employee Development
positive.description: Invests in worker growth, safety, and meaningful contribution

negative.name: Employee Exploitation
negative.description: Treats workers as disposable resources for profit extraction

dipoles.name: Governance Transparency
dipoles.description: How business communications handle accountability and decision-making processes

positive.name: Accountability
positive.description: Demonstrates transparent governance and responsible decision-making

negative.name: Opacity
negative.description: Conceals decision-making processes and avoids accountability

dipoles.name: Financial Integrity
dipoles.description: How business communications handle financial responsibility and reporting

positive.name: Financial Responsibility
positive.description: Demonstrates prudent financial management and honest reporting

negative.name: Financial Manipulation
negative.description: Engages in accounting manipulation or unsustainable financial practices

dipoles.name: Strategic Purpose
dipoles.description: How business communications frame long-term purpose and societal impact

positive.name: Sustainable Purpose
positive.description: Articulates long-term value creation for society and stakeholders

negative.name: Short-term Extraction
negative.description: Focuses solely on short-term profit extraction without regard for long-term consequences

calculation_method.description: Calculate center of mass accounting for cluster-based dipole organization
calculation_method.formula: COM = Σ(cluster_weight × dipole_COM) for each cluster

prompt_configuration.expert_role: You are an expert business ethics analyst specializing in stakeholder capitalism, corporate governance, and sustainable business practices with deep knowledge of ethical frameworks for evaluating business communications.
prompt_configuration.analysis_focus: Evaluate how business communications demonstrate ethical orientation across three domains: stakeholder relationships, operational integrity, and strategic vision, noting clustering patterns within each domain.
prompt_configuration.scoring_emphasis: Assess ethical positioning within each domain cluster, considering how different business ethics concerns manifest in distinct areas of corporate communication.
prompt_configuration.evidence_requirements: Provide specific textual evidence supporting each well score, explaining how language patterns reflect underlying business ethics assumptions within each domain cluster.

cluster_awareness: Recognize that dipoles are clustered by business domain
Stakeholder relations cluster focuses on customer and employee treatment
Operational integrity cluster addresses governance and financial practices
Strategic vision cluster examines long-term purpose and sustainability
Consider domain-specific ethical patterns and language

com.name: Center of Mass
com.description: Overall ethical orientation considering cluster-weighted dipole forces

ccs.name: Cluster Coherence Score
ccs.description: Consistency of ethical orientation within each domain cluster

des.name: Domain Ethics Score
des.description: Ethical performance score for each of the three business domains
